results.title: It's so nice to have a wolf around the house
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Paul Fierlinger
results.brief_description: An animated film, based on a book by Harry Allard which tells of an old man and his ageing pets, who decides to advertise for a companion to take care of them and pep them all up. A wolf named Cuthbert Q. Devine answers the call, turning their little houseboat into a happier place - but not without some adventures along the way.

results.title: It's so easy. - [rev. ed.]
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: Demonstrates correct practices for safety in small boats. Illustrates common types of accidents and their prevention, maintenance, life jackets, safety harness and survival swimming.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Donald Crombie

results.title: It's so easy
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Martin-Jones and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: Deals with the basic rules of safety at sea. Emphasises the need to be aware of the dangers. Always check gear, don’t overload, carry a radio for any warning of weather change, state destination before departing, and obey the rules of the “water road”. Outlines technique of survival swimming.

results.title: It's snow
results.brief_description: Color cut-out animation inspired by the shape of snowflakes and touched with the airy magic of these fragile designs. While music tinkles invitingly, snowflakes roll and whirl, pulse and glitter, shining with the many hues of twinkling lights. Made without words, this is a joyous film to please the fancy and captivate eye and ear.

results.title: It's Ruth
results.brief_description: A biography of Ruth Cracknell, the renowned Australian actor whose career has spanned half a century. While her work encompasses all genres and mediums she is best known for her comic roles, especially that of Maggie Bear in the long running ABC television series ‘Mother and Son’. In this documentary, interviews with various associates and friends focus on the eccentric elements of her work and her ability to juxtapose the tragic and the comic in her performances. Excerpts from ‘Mother and Son’, Beckett’s play ‘Happy Days’, Elizabeth Jolley’s short story ‘Woman in a Lampshade, Oscar Wilde’s play ‘The Importance of Being Ernest’ and Neil Simon’s play ‘Lost in Yonkers’ are included.

results.title: It's our's whatever they say
results.brief_description: A fatal accident to a child provokes the parents on a council estate into fighting for the provision of an adventure playground. The film is shot as a newsreel, tracing the day by day advances and setbacks of the tenants.
results.description: A fatal accident to a child provokes the parents on a council estate into fighting for the provision of an adventure playground. The film is shot as a newsreel, tracing the day by day advances and setbacks of the tenants.

results.title: It's one family: knock on wood
results.creator_credit: De Nonno Pix and Tony De Nonno
results.brief_description: An absorbing look at an Italian-American family who continue to carry on a family tradition of some sixty years of operating a marionette theatre. The family makes and paints the marionettes, which are almost life-sized and extremely heavy, makes the armour and other costumes, operates the marionettes, provides the music and sells the tickets. An excellent example of a traditional Sicilian form of theatre.

results.title: It's OK to be deaf
results.creator_credit: Institute of Educational Administration and Peter Brighton
results.brief_description: Records the attempts by the mother of a profoundly deaf student to obtain adecuate schooling for her daughter within a normal school environment. Underlines the importance in particular of not treating children with hearing impairment as different from children without hearing impairments.

results.title: It's not easy
results.creator_credit: Inland Films, Film Australia, Sandra Alexander and Judy Rymer
results.brief_description: Made in association with the Family Court of Australia, this program looks at the effect on children of broken marriages, and the way that the Family Courts can counsel parents. Three case studies illustrate different problems and how they can be solved.

results.title: It's not always happy at my home (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A dramatised account of domestic violence in a middle class American family. Aimed, in part, at children, this video treats issues at a personal level, and touches on a number of relevant issues such as role stereotypes, counselling, refuges and peer support.
